basic_info.description_header: ðŸ‘‹ Hi, welcome to my corner of the internet!
basic_info.description: I'm a 3rd year Software Engineering student at UWaterloo with a background in Mechatronics! I enjoy and have experience with backend development at scale through my 3rd internship at Wish, end-to-end machine learning experience from all of my internships as well as side projects, and autonomous driving experience through university student teams and personal projects. Additionally, I'm always on the lookout for SWE internship opportunities!

projects.title: Autonomous Mini Car
projects.description: I took the ideas I had bottled up in my head about how AV Software is architected & implemented, paired it with curiousity, design team experience & self-learning, and built my very own autonomous mini car from scratch!

projects.title: Backend Microservice Design
projects.description: Owned, architected and built an end-to-end solution that acts as a centralized data access point within a massive codebase as an intern! Focused on 4 core pillars: concurrency, expandability, modularity, usability.

projects.title: AV Scene Understanding
projects.description: As a core member of the WATonomous design team, this was the culmination of my design and code contribution to our environment modeling module (part of perception). After building out the subsystem, integrating it into the main system + testing, my code was used in our Autonomous Chevy Bolt on real roads as a part of the General Motors AutoDrive Challenge!

projects.title: Swap Robotics
projects.description: Some awesome pictures of one of our company robots in all its glory. I interned here and was a part of a team of 3 founding engineers!

projects.title: Backend ML System Design
projects.description: This is a highlevel architecture diagram that I designed and implemented as part of a previous internship. We followed this architecture in building out our recommendation system (yellow) and (green) shows my end-to-end work as a Machine Learning Engineer building out 1 of the 2 potential models, to be the brains of our system.

projects.title: Robotic Prosthetic Arm
projects.description: This arm was as fun attempt at building an affordable prosthetic (POC of course). It included adjustable pinching force (incl. PID control algo), ability to hold a pencil and eraser (+write and erase), could play rock paper scissors, as well as some more functionality.

projects.title: Computer Vision Product
projects.description: This is a project I worked on at a previous coop, where I built a robot mounted image classification system running on an NVIDIA board to detect sidewalk defects. I built the depth camera pipeline, and took on some ML Engineer responsibilities by training and deploying a CNN based classification system with the collected data.

projects.title: Vechicle Tracking System
projects.description: Here we have an architecture diagram of our vehicle tracking system built for a Chevy Camaro and the autonomous part of the EcoCar Challenge. It includes sensor interfacing, noise reduction, sensor fusion (via data association, kalmnan filtering).

projects.title: Research Paper
projects.description: Co-authored a research paper based on environment modeling (scene understanding) approaches developed by me and a few members of the WATonomous design team.
